pr_title: RSS Regression: Upload pmap output to cloud storage, compare between runs

timeline.message: Capture pmap output, upload to IBM cloud storage, compute RSS regression based on <10% from previous run

timeline.bodyText: You really want to make Max happy, right?
timeline.author: cescoffier
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -43,21 +43,40 @@ jobs:
       - name: Check RSS
         env:
           QUICKSTART_VERSION: "1.0-SNAPSHOT"
-          RSS_THRESHOLD: "25000"
+          RSS_THRESHOLD: "40000"
           START_TIME_THRESHOLD: "1000"
+          BUCKET_NAME: ${{ secrets.BUCKET_NAME }}
+          REMOTE_OBJECT_NAME: "pmap.out"
+          API_KEY: ${{ secrets.API_KEY }}
+          SERVICE_INSTANCE_ID: ${{ secrets.SERVICE_INSTANCE_ID }}
+
         run: |
-          getting-started/target/getting-started-${QUICKSTART_VERSION}-runner -Xmx2m > server.log &
+          sudo apt-get update -o Dir::Etc::sourcelist="sources.list" -o Dir::Etc::sourceparts="-" -o APT::Get::List-Cleanup="0"
+          sudo apt-get install -y gnupg2 gnupg-agent
+          echo Installing SDKMAN
+          curl -s "https://get.sdkman.io" | bash
+          source ~/.sdkman/bin/sdkman-init.sh
+          sdk install jbang

replies.bodyText: fyi, you could have used the maxandersen/jbang-action docker image here
replies.author: maxandersen

timeline.bodyText: We may very soon have multiple API_KEY, can you prefix it with something like S3_API_KEY?
timeline.author: cescoffier
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -43,21 +43,40 @@ jobs:
       - name: Check RSS
         env:
           QUICKSTART_VERSION: "1.0-SNAPSHOT"
-          RSS_THRESHOLD: "25000"
+          RSS_THRESHOLD: "40000"
           START_TIME_THRESHOLD: "1000"
+          BUCKET_NAME: ${{ secrets.BUCKET_NAME }}
+          REMOTE_OBJECT_NAME: "pmap.out"
+          API_KEY: ${{ secrets.API_KEY }}

replies.author: johnaohara

timeline.bodyText: Maybe indicate somewhere that this retrieves the previous pmap and compare it to the new one.
timeline.author: cescoffier
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -43,21 +43,40 @@ jobs:
       - name: Check RSS
         env:
           QUICKSTART_VERSION: "1.0-SNAPSHOT"
-          RSS_THRESHOLD: "25000"
+          RSS_THRESHOLD: "40000"
           START_TIME_THRESHOLD: "1000"
+          BUCKET_NAME: ${{ secrets.BUCKET_NAME }}
+          REMOTE_OBJECT_NAME: "pmap.out"
+          API_KEY: ${{ secrets.API_KEY }}
+          SERVICE_INSTANCE_ID: ${{ secrets.SERVICE_INSTANCE_ID }}
+
         run: |
-          getting-started/target/getting-started-${QUICKSTART_VERSION}-runner -Xmx2m > server.log &
+          sudo apt-get update -o Dir::Etc::sourcelist="sources.list" -o Dir::Etc::sourceparts="-" -o APT::Get::List-Cleanup="0"
+          sudo apt-get install -y gnupg2 gnupg-agent
+          echo Installing SDKMAN
+          curl -s "https://get.sdkman.io" | bash
+          source ~/.sdkman/bin/sdkman-init.sh
+          sdk install jbang
+          getting-started/target/getting-started-${QUICKSTART_VERSION}-runner -Xmx2m -Dquarkus.http.io-threads=1 -Dquarkus.vertx.worker-pool-size=1 > server.log &
           sleep 2
+          appPid=$!
+          pmap -x $appPid > pmap.out
           ps --no-headers  -C getting-started-${QUICKSTART_VERSION}-runner -o rss > rss.out
           rss=$(< rss.out)
-          echo "Threshold (kB): ${RSS_THRESHOLD}"
+          echo "Max RSS Threshold (kB): ${RSS_THRESHOLD}"
           echo "RSS (kB): $rss"
           startTime=$(grep -oP "started in \K([0-9]*\.[0-9]*)" server.log)
           startTimeMs=$(echo "$startTime*1000/1" | bc)
           echo "Start time Threshold (ms): ${START_TIME_THRESHOLD}"
           echo "Start time (ms): $startTimeMs"
+          jbang .github/RssRegression.java ${BUCKET_NAME} ${API_KEY} ${SERVICE_INSTANCE_ID} ${REMOTE_OBJECT_NAME} pmap.old.out pmap.out

replies.bodyText: BTW you fails the build it the ration is greater to 1.1 between the old and new one. However, you upload the new one anyway (even if the build failed). So it's unlikely we can catch the regression in the next builds.
replies.author: cescoffier

replies.bodyText:
We should probably make that 1.1 configurable.
What happens in the case that the +10% RSS is genuinely related to an increase as a result of the build tools, i.e. not a regression caused by a bug. It could be valid, all though it requires manual validation, hence the failure and should be compared against the next builds.
replies.author: johnaohara

replies.bodyText: Having said that, RSS regression tripping would be the most common failure path, and I am archiving the pmap output with every run. So if it does trip, and is genuinely due to the tooling, we could manually replace the pmap file stored in the cloud bucket
replies.author: johnaohara

replies.bodyText: Have changed to upload only if does not regress
replies.author: johnaohara

timeline.message: Only upload pmap object if there is no regression

timeline.bodyText: This line should be moved no?
timeline.author: cescoffier

timeline.bodyText: fyi you can greatly simplify the parsing and usage text by using picocli ... not a blocker for the PR but just a pointer.  example: https://github.com/maxandersen/jbang/blob/master/examples/smee.java#L51
timeline.author: maxandersen
